channel.title: Virus Help Please
channel.description:
Hello I was doing a projet for english and I downloaded a book to help me on the topic and it was actually a TrojanDownload, It has disabled my task manager and I have pop ups like every minute saying my computer is infected with spyware to buy these Anti-Virus programs. It has also changes my desktop background to a light blue that says "your computer is infected click here to fix it.
Any help would be great thanks I did a whole bunch of virus scans with AVG and McAfee but the virus keeps comming back.

item.title: Virus Help Please
item.dc:creator: @ZdotP ZdotP
item.description:
@ZdotP wrote:

LOL, okay well if youve used 10 different AV’s then best thing to do is to re-install Windows like the other guys said… You can find WinXP on www.thepiratebay.org , www.torrentz.com and other sites, aslong as you have a Bit Torrent client EG Bitcomet, utorrent ect. If you have Vista then I THINK you can find it on those sites…but im not sure.

And guys, please no sarcastic comments to my post :P. Ive been on this forum for 7 months (yeah i couldnt sign up cause of the microsoft crap) and I know what your all like.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus Help Please
item.dc:creator: @Legend_Of_Slayer Legend Of Slayer
item.description:
@Legend_Of_Slayer wrote:

I still can’t get rid of the virus I have tried over 10 different Anti-Virus programs and still have it and it wont let me do a system restore, It does the restore then says the restore couldn’t work. When ever I go on the internet I get mad pop-ups till my comp freezes also my task manager is disabled because the stupud virus keeps disabling it. I may have to pay someone to come take a look at it and hopefully fix it, Un less I can lol

Read full topic

item.title: Virus Help Please
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

spankjava:

Yeh but most computers need you to create a backup before

most computer come with a factory issued backup… so it is the same as you got it. With nothing on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus Help Please
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

I have no firewall, but I have AVG free. I only ever turn it on once every 6months or when i think i might have something.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus Help Please
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

jme:

I actually don’t have a firewall or anti-virus program. All I need is common sense and maybe ad-aware to get rid of spyware once in a blue moon.

Likewise.

[quote=“davidude36, post:15, topic:199644”]Wow i’m same as jme and kane, I neither have a virus scanner nor firewall. Yet there is people without good computer sense (Such as my gf who has NORTON) who still manage to get harmful virus’s, and then theres people like me whom have good computer sense but sometimes don’t even need an anti virus program.

Ok, take the messages in the popups and type them in Google. Most likely someone else on another forum somewhere had the same virus.

This is why you get linux

Why does his message symbolise anything to do with getting linux?[/quote]

Because he wants epeen++ from mopar for spreading the word.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus Help Please
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Wow i’m same as jme and kane, I neither have a virus scanner nor firewall. Yet there is people without good computer sense (Such as my gf who has NORTON) who still manage to get harmful virus’s, and then theres people like me whom have good computer sense but sometimes don’t even need an anti virus program.

[quote=“pk4pk, post:7, topic:199644”][quote author=Zach1188 link=topic=264300.msg2185344#msg2185344 date=1208143937]
Ok, take the messages in the popups and type them in Google. Most likely someone else on another forum somewhere had the same virus.
[/quote]
This is why you get linux[/quote]
Why does his message symbolise anything to do with getting linux?

item.title: Virus Help Please
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:12, topic:199644”][quote author=zoss0 link=topic=264300.msg2185892#msg2185892 date=1208156685]

Ok, take the messages in the popups and type them in Google. Most likely someone else on another forum somewhere had the same virus.

This is why you get linux

Or you be careful of what sites you go on, and your fine.

Get a better anti-virus next time?
[/quote]

Yes, I personally recommend the anti-virus called “common sense.” It doesn’t require a download and provides great protection.

I use it, and never have any problems.

I actually don’t have a firewall or anti-virus program. All I need is common sense and maybe ad-aware to get rid of spyware once in a blue moon.[/quote]
I’m the same, no virus scanner, no firewall.
Every 2 months or so i just scan with Ad-Aware.

If a site look suspicious, it probably is.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus Help Please
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“zoss0, post:11, topic:199644”][quote author=pk4pk link=topic=264300.msg2185351#msg2185351 date=1208144040]

Ok, take the messages in the popups and type them in Google. Most likely someone else on another forum somewhere had the same virus.

This is why you get linux
[/quote]
Or you be careful of what sites you go on, and your fine.

Get a better anti-virus next time?[/quote]

Yes, I personally recommend the anti-virus called “common sense.” It doesn’t require a download and provides great protection.

I use it, and never have any problems.

I actually don’t have a firewall or anti-virus program. All I need is common sense and maybe ad-aware to get rid of spyware once in a blue moon.
